CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-1 - Lawful arrest or detention);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Speediness of review)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE he obtained a NORP passport .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , GPE , ordered to arrest and bring the applicant to the court in order to determine the preventive measure during the investigation of his alleged robbery . The applicant ’s name was put on the international list of wanted persons .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in GPE . As the applicant was a NORP national , he was released .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP authorities sought the applicant ’s extradition from GPE in relation to the criminal proceedings against him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Russian ORG concluded that the applicant had fraudulently obtained his NORP passport by falsifying a number of documents . They ordered to seize his passport and put his name on the federal wanted list . The applicant ’s subsequent attempts to challenge ORG decision on his NORP passport were unsuccessful .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested . On DATE a prosecutor authorised his detention considering that the decision of CARDINAL DATE of ORG had authorised the applicant ’s “ placement into custody ” , as mentioned in LAW § CARDINAL of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE a district prosecutor decided that the applicant should be “ placed in custody ” considering that the decision of ORG of Dnepropetrovsk of DATE authorised “ placement into custody ” , as required under LAW of LAW ( “ the CCrP ” ) .

CARDINAL . On several occasions the applicant unsuccessfully complained about his detention to the prosecuting authorities . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed the applicant ’s complaint considering that his arrest and detention in relation to the NORP extradition request had been and remained lawful . On DATE ORG upheld this decision of DATE concluding that “ matters relating to lawfulness and reasons for detention should be raised under another procedure prescribed by law ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the extradition request . On DATE ORG confirmed the decision of DATE . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to the NORP authorities in the town of GPE . On DATE he was transferred to the town of GPE . On DATE a NORP court refused to order the applicant ’s detention pending the investigation . The applicant was released .
